# EDA

Let's explore the data a bit! Before continuing, I encourage you to check out the documentation on [Multi-Level Indexing](http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/advanced.html) and [Using .xs](http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.xs.html).
Reference the solutions if you can not figure out how to use .xs(), since that will be a major part of this project.

** What is the max Close price for each bank's stock throughout the time period?**
source.9f22ad0e:
## Data

We need to get data using pandas datareader. We will get stock information for the following banks:
*  Bank of America
* CitiGroup
* Goldman Sachs
* JPMorgan Chase
* Morgan Stanley
* Wells Fargo

source.40becfae:
# Stock Market Crisis Analysis 

In this data project we will focus on exploratory data analysis of stock prices.

We'll focus on bank stocks and see how they progressed throughout the [financial crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_crisis_of_2007%E2%80%9308) all the way to early 2016.
source.d174c60f: ** Take a look at the standard deviation of the returns, which stock would you classify as the riskiest over the entire time period? Which would you classify as the riskiest for the year 2015?**
source.7ec6176a:
** Create a new empty DataFrame called returns. This dataframe will contain the returns for each bank's stock. returns are typically defined by:**

$$r_t = \frac{p_t - p_{t-1}}{p_{t-1}} = \frac{p_t}{p_{t-1}} - 1$$
